Class SimpleProjectile

  • java.lang.Object
    • SimpleProjectile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Particle

    public class SimpleProjectile
extends java.lang.Object
implements Particle
    Implementation class representing Newtonian particle. It contains initial 2D positions and velocities and calculates position value of any Newtonian particle for a given time t.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleProjectile(float initialX, float initialY, float initialVx, float initialVy)
      Construct a SimpleProjectile object that has the provided initial x-coordinate position, y-coordinate position, initial velocity Vx and Vy.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleProjectile

        public SimpleProjectile(float initialX,
                        float initialY,
                        float initialVx,
                        float initialVy)
        Construct a SimpleProjectile object that has the provided initial x-coordinate position, y-coordinate position, initial velocity Vx and Vy.
        Parameters:
        initialX - the x-coordinate value for initial position of the particle.
        initialY - the y-coordinate value for initial position of the particle.
        initialVx - the initial velocity Vx of the particle.
        initialVy - the initial velocity Vy of the particle.

    • Method Detail

      • getState

        public java.lang.String getState(float time)
        Return the state of this particle as a formatted string. The format of the string is as follows: At time [t]: position is ([x],[y]) where,
        • [t] is the time passed to this method, rounded to two decimal places.
        • [x] is the x-coordinate of the position of this particle at this time, rounded to two decimal places.
        • [y] is the y-coordinate of the position of this particle at this time, rounded to two decimal places.
        At any time t, the state is calculated using the following formula:

        s=ut+1/2at^2

        Since x component will have no effect of gravity, we take a=0 for calculating x component of displacement.

        Specified by:
        getState in interface Particle
        Parameters:
        time - the time at which the state must be obtained.
        Returns:
        the state of the particle as a string formatted as above.
